Posts.Content: 1awesomemom wrote: Hi ladies...this is my 1st post here.  I have my 8th & final round of chemo next Tuesday, YAY!  My breast surgeon says that I'll likely be scheduling my bilateral mastectomy 3 weeks from then.  Chemo has been really hard on me & I've heard from numerous sources that the surgery is a breeze compared to months of chemo.  I'm hoping this is true & wondering what you all think.  I will not be having reconstruction so I don't have to deal with chest expanders.  Also, I'll be doing 12 weeks of radiation after surgery, is there anything I need to know as far as healing while doing rads?  Thank you! :) Dx 9/19/2010, IDC, 5cm, Stage IIA, Grade 3, ER+/PR+, HER2+ Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Which is harder...chemo or bilateral mastectomy? 1awesomemom BMac

Posts.Content: Mar 17, 2011 11:45PM 1awesomemom wrote: Thank you all so much for the replies!!!  The majority has told me that surgery is easier than chemo...thank goodness! I don't even want to show up on Tuesday for my final round.  Chemo has been a difficult journey for me.  My poor boys, ages 4, 6 & 12, want their happy mom back.  The physical SE's of chemo are bad enough but I seem to have lost all my patience & I'm super irritable.  I'm looking forward to this surgery...just take it all & get it all :)  It's such a relief to hear that the hardest part is almost over.  I don't know how anyone does chemo for more than 6 months.  Good luck to all you ladies!!  xoxo
Posts.Title: Which is harder...chemo or bilateral mastectomy? 1awesomemom BMac

Posts.Content: 1awesomemom wrote: Hello everyone!  I had my bilateral mastectomy without reconstruction last week.  Things are going swimmingly but these darn drains are driving me nuts!  My questions is...how long do most women have the drains in?  I'm on day 8...seems like forever.  Also, the entry site for the drains are very painful.  They are not infected just painful.  They're more painful than my surgery incisions. I'm also terrified to get them removed.  Is it true that the skin can heal around the drains & make it difficult to remove?  Does it hurt when they're removed?  Thanks for your input!! xoxoxo Dx 9/19/2010, IDC, 5cm, Stage IIA, Grade 3, ER+/PR+, HER2+ Log in to post a reply
